div.div: Wisconsin's Safer at Home Order has been extended until May 26 and school building closures have been mandated by the Governors office to extend through the remainder of the school year. Families will receive more information in our weekly communication on Friday.

Changes to Text Messages Sent by AASD

div.a: Changes to Text Messages Sent by AASD
div.div: Instead of receiving multiple messages, you will receive a text message with the first 100 characters, followed by a web link (URL). By clicking on the link, you can read the complete message.
Work permits for minors under 16 years old are not required during the public health emergency.
The scheduled March 30 summer school registration opening is postponed.
United Way 2-1-1 provides easy, simple access to health and human services, gives callers an opportunity to get or give help, and serves as a hub for community information in times of disaster.
We will continue to monitor the situation, and we will certainly provide any necessary updates as we learn of them. The safety and well-being of our students and staff remain our utmost priority.

We look forward to the additional support this program will bring to our schools and students. We believe that our schools present one of the best opportunities for early identification of children needing care and support for mental health challenges. The earlier we can provide support and interventions, the better our chance to support mental wellness for all of our students.

A-Tech students graduate ready for further schooling or to start a full-time job the week after graduation. They can produce and assemble structural metal products, read job orders and blueprints, and set up and use equipment to cut, shear, saw, form, roll, and bend metals.
AASD scored excellent in 7 of 8 School Health Index (SHI) categories. The district exceeds the state average in all 8 SHI categories.

a.title: Auto Opportunities Abound in the AASD

div.a: Auto Opportunities Abound in the AASD
div.div: All of these high school students are learning with professional tools on actual vehicles with real problems.

a.title: Is your child well enough to come to school?

div.a: Is your child well enough to come to school?
div.div: If your child will be absent, please remember to call your child's school or leave a message before 9:00 a.m. Please state your childs name, teacher name, and reason for the absence.
As we start a new semester and potentially new classes for your student, we wanted you to remind you how to gain Parent Access to Canvas.

We understand that we are all on high alert right now based upon the recent incidents in Waukesha and Oshkosh. Please know that we, the staff of the Appleton Area School District, will continue to work with the Appleton Police Department to ensure the safety of our students. In addition, we also rely on our students, staff and parents to contact the building principal and/or the Appleton Police Department regarding any possible threats. The safety of our students is our highest priority.

a.title: State Report Cards: What We Want You to Know

div.a: State Report Cards: What We Want You to Know
div.div: We encourage you to watch the below video that explains key pieces of information regarding the 2018-19 state report card and how it serves as a tool for driving the districts ongoing continuous school improvement efforts.

a.title: 15 Schools Recognized with School Health Award

div.a: 15 Schools Recognized with School Health Award
div.div: In an effort to improve schools and school systems, the Wisconsin School Health Award is a way to recognize and celebrate schools with policies, programs, and the infrastructure to promote and sustain a healthy learning environment.
